abstract.p: Photos of several black outfits on summer day in New York (On the Street column)

block.p: You don't need a calendar to know that Labor Day is near. Black is a tradition with some city dwellers as summer fades. For them, it signals the approach of that mythical autumn in New York, the time for fresh adrenaline, new conquests. ''Who died?'' August tourists used to say when they saw this funereal gear. But last week, many of the map-and-camera set were themselves slipcovered in black.
